intro: Silene italica var. patula, commonly known as Italian catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-red flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20 to 40 centimeters, with linear, hairy leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are arranged in dense, spike-like clusters and are pollinated primarily by insects. Silene italica var. patula is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
